Columbia’s operating activities in fiscal year 2025

Total operating revenue rose by 2 percent, while total operating expenses increased by 5 percent.

Operating revenue

Operating expenses

Tuition and fees: $1.6B

+4% from 2024

Instruction and educational administration: $2.5B

+2% from 2024

Government grants: $1.3B

-1% from 2024

Research expenses: $989M

+4% from 2024

Total revenue: $6.7B

+2% from 2024

Patient care revenue: $1.9B

Total expenses: $6.6B

+6% from 2024

Patient care expenses: $1.7B

+5% from 2024

+8% from 2024

Investment income: $863M

+6% from 2024

Operations and maintenance: $405M

+10% from 2024

Private gifts and grants: $590M

Operating surplus: $113M

Institutional support: $459M

-10% from 2024

-63% from 2024

+19% from 2024

Other educational and research activities: $252M

Auxiliary costs: $232M

-3% from 2024

+2% from 2024

Sales and services of auxiliary enterprises: $252M

Depreciation: $323M

+2% from 2024

-2% from 2024

Interest: $79M

+18% from 2024

Source: Columbia University Financial Reports
